I think that it would address a crosscutting concern of the run. Pretty muc=
h
like aspects work. This way you could enrich the test-run by declarativel=
y
hooking into the execution. Having global rules you could for instance,
g=
iven a match-criteria selects points in the run to hook into.

How about "d=
eclaratively enhance" as a meaning?

Whatever implementation you choose I h=
ave the following wishes based on
working with bumblebee and trying to do t=
hese kind of global enhancements:

* That I do not /have to/ run the tests =
via a specific suite to have my
global rules applied. The reason is that it=
's sometimes desirable to run
only one test and it would be nice if that te=
st is enhanced in the same way
it would be if run via the suite.

* That I =
would not have to add anymore information than can be found on the
class pa=
th. The reason is that needing specific configuration such as system
proper=
ties or environment variables would make my tests harder to run.

I have of=
ten wanted to make this kind of global rules and I think that
having the po=
ssibility would open up for a host of new ways to creatively
enhance JUnit.=
 Tools such as bumblebee being one   of many things that would
be simple to=
 do given such a feature. I hooked into a suite to capture
System.out for b=
umblebee documentation and it works well given that I run
via that suite. I=
f I don't run via that suite I have experienced hard to
debug problems.
